conditional-visibility.setting.autoSteal: [Not recommended now you can manage everything and better with AE] On supported game systems, set the hidden condition on a token's stealth roll
conditional-visibility.setting.useEagleE: A embedded version of the module https://github.com/trioderegion/eagle-eye/
conditional-visibility.setting.reset.hin: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
conditional-visibility.setting.debug.lab: Prints debug messages to the console
conditional-visibility.setting.passivePe: [Not recommended now you can manage everything and better with AE] Make sense only with 'Auto hide on stealth rolls' setting set to true. Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each actor's passive perception. For example, in D&D5e system, each actor's passive perception is stored in the item's "actor.data.data.skills.prc.passive" attribute, so you'd put "data.skills.prc.passive" in this setting.
conditional-visibility.setting.passiveSt: [Not recommended now you can manage everything and better with AE] Make sense only with 'Auto hide on stealth rolls' setting set to true. Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each actor's passive stealth. For example, in D&D5e system, each actor's passive stealth is stored in the item's "actor.data.data.skills.ste.passive" attribute, so you'd put "data.skills.ste.passive" in this setting.
conditional-visibility.setting.activeSte: [Not recommended now you can manage everything and better with AE] Make sense only with 'Auto hide on stealth rolls' setting set to true. Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each actor's passive stealth. For example, in D&D5e system, each actor's active stealth is stored in the item's "actor.data.data.skills.ste.total" attribute, so you'd put "data.skills.ste.total" in this setting.
conditional-visibility.setting.npcType.h: Here you can configure what the type of NPC actor of your system for the sight check. For example, in D&D5e system, the type is on the property "actor.type" an is value is 'npc', so you'd put "npc" in this setting.
conditional-visibility.setting.enableHud: Add Token HUD element to disable/enable hidden condition
conditional-visibility.setting.hudPos.hi: HUD position of the hidden button on the token
conditional-visibility.setting.disableFo: This will avoid the sight check for all the token with disposition FRIENDLY or NEUTRAL
conditional-visibility.setting.disableDC: Disable automatic import on module 'DFreds Convenient Effects'
This will avoid the automatic import of all sense and condition on the module 'DFreds Convenient Effects'
conditional-visibility.token.config.extr: Additional senses that may enhance vision, for unlimited range use <= -1, for disable/remove use 0
Additional conditions that may enhance vision, for unlimited range use <= -1, for disable/remove use 0
conditional-visibility.effects.default.d: This sense is used from the module 'Conditional Visibility'
This sense is used from the module 'Conditional Visibility'
conditional-visibility.effects.none.name: None
None ({number})
conditional-visibility.effects.none.desc: This sense is used from the module 'Conditional Visibility'
This sense is used from the module 'Conditional Visibility'
conditional-visibility.effects.normal.de: This sense is used from the module 'Conditional Visibility'
This sense is used from the module 'Conditional Visibility'
conditional-visibility.effects.blinded.d:
A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.

A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
conditional-visibility.effects.darkvisio: A monster with Darkvision can see in the dark within a specific radius. The monster can see in dim light within the radius as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. The monster can't discern color in Darkness, only Shades of Gray. Many Creatures that live Underground have this Special sense.

A monster with Darkvision can see in the dark within a radius of {number}. The monster can see in dim light within the radius as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. The monster can't discern color in Darkness, only Shades of Gray. Many Creatures that live Underground have this Special sense.
conditional-visibility.effects.tremorsen: A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures. Many burrowing creatures, such as ankhegs and umber hulks, have this special sense.

A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a radius of {number}, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures. Many burrowing creatures, such as ankhegs and umber hulks, have this special sense.
conditional-visibility.effects.seeinvisi: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible within a radius of {number}, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.
conditional-visibility.effects.blindsigh:
A monster with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a specific radius.
Creatures without eyes, such as grimlocks and gray oozes, typically have this special sense, as do creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons.
If a monster is naturally blind, it has a parenthetical note to this effect, indicating that the radius of its blindsight defines the maximum range of its perception.

A monster with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a radius of {number}.
Creatures without eyes, such as grimlocks and gray oozes, typically have this special sense, as do creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons.
If a monster is naturally blind, it has a parenthetical note to this effect, indicating that the radius of its blindsight defines the maximum range of its perception.
conditional-visibility.effects.truesight: A monster with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.

Within a radius of {number} a monster with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.
conditional-visibility.effects.devilssig: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a certain distance.
You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of {number}.
conditional-visibility.effects.lowlightv: A creature with low-light vision can see in dim light as though it were bright light, so it ignores the concealed condition due to dim light.
Within a radius of {number} a creature with low-light vision can see in dim light as though it were bright light, so it ignores the concealed condition due to dim light.
conditional-visibility.effects.greaterda: A creature with darkvision or greater darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level darkness spell, block normal darkvision. A creature with greater darkvision, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.

Within a radius of {number} a creature with darkvision or greater darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level darkness spell, block normal darkvision. A creature with greater darkvision, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.

conditional-visibility.dialogs.stealth.n: Conditional Visibility does not support the hidden condition/stealth for {sysid}
conditional-visibility.dialogs.stealthro: Stealh Roll, for unlimited range use <= -1, for disable/remove use 0
This value will be compared with sense value from the source token (if present on the system) as long is the token is hiding.  Non-numeric entries will result in the initial value being taken
conditional-visibility.dialogs.resetsett: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
conditional-visibility.dialogs.nosystemf:
This system is not currently fully supported. This means that the module does not know how to best handle this system's items, but can still operate in a limited fashion.

You can configure the module's settings yourself, but it requires a bit of technical know-how.

If you have any questions, ping Wasp#2005 on the Foundry discord.
conditional-visibility.dialogs.systemfou:
This system was previously not supported, but in an recent update it was added as a supported system!

Do you want to load this system's default Item Pile settings?
